forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. North northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 51, with temperatures rising to around 53 overnight. South southeast wind 7 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
This afternoon in Downtown San Francisco, the weather embraces that familiar chill, with the skies mostly sunny but hinting at a conspicuous twist of gray that promises rain as dusk approaches. While the temperature hovers around a cool 58 degrees, the afternoon light may bring a brief warmth before the clouds conspire to blanket the city. As twilight unfolds, expect those clouds to thicken with certainty, transforming to a curtain of rain after 10 PM, introducing a gusty south-southeast wind which will stir as the temperatures rise slightly to 53 degrees.

The visibility may shimmer slightly under the afternoon sun, but expect a creeping fog, particularly towards the bay, veiling the distant outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge in its steady embrace. With such a predictable shift in weather, dress comfortably but wisely—layers are your ally against the dropping temperatures and the impending dampness. As the rain takes hold later tonight, consider retreating into your favorite café or local bookstore, perhaps with a good book in hand or a warm cup of tea, allowing the rhythm of the rain to lull you into that quiet state of reflection that only nights like these can inspire.
